briefdescription.para: Constructor to insert a cell into Dish "who" Used to add a new Cell to the dish: new Cell(dish, celtype).
Default copy constructor.
Add a new cell to the dish.

detaileddescription.para: Call it as: new Cell(parent, true); mother will be modified for ancestry administration!

briefdescription.para: Assignment operator.

detaileddescription.para: Called if one cell is assigned to another. Remember to change both assignment operator and copy constructor when adding new attributes to Cell.

briefdescription.para: Returns false if Cell has apoptosed (vanished).
Returns the cell colour.
Set cell type of this Cell.
Get cell type of this Cell.
Set color of this cell to new_colour, irrespective of type.
Return Cell's actual area.
Return Cell's target area.
Set the Cell's target length.

detaileddescription.para: Debugging function used to print the cell's current inertia tensor (as used for calculations of the length )

briefdescription.para: Returns the cell's cell identity number.
Sets the target area of the cell.
Sends the current cell into apoptosis.
Decrement the cell's target area by one unit.
Increment the cell's target area by one unit.
Cell lineage tracking: get the cell's parent.
Cell lineage tracking: get the cell's daughter.
Returns a counter keeping track of the number of divisions.
Returns Monte Carlo Step (MCS) when this cell originated.
Returns the cell type at the time of birth.
Returns the bond energy J between this cell and cell c2.
Set the current gradient of the cell to g. Currently not in use.
Returns the cell's measured gradient. Currently not in use.
Returns the cell's measured gradient. Currently not in use.
Returns the cell's measured gradient. Currently not in use.
Currently not in use (remove?)
Currently not in use (remove?)

detaileddescription.para: After introducing a new Cell (e.g. with GrowInCell) call this function to set the moments and areas right.

briefdescription.para: Increments the cell's actual adhesive area by 1 unit.
Decrement the cell's actual adhesive area by 1 unit.
Clears the table of J's.

detaileddescription.para: This is only important for a feature called "DynamicJ's", where J-values depend on internal states of the cells (such as a genetic network; see e.g. Hogeweg et al. 2000). The current version of TST does not include such functionality.

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum cell identity number in the Dish. This would normally be the number of cells in the Dish, although the number includes apoptosed cells.
Sets bond energy J between cell type t1 and t2 to val.
Read a table of static Js. First line: number of types (including medium) Next lines: diagonal matrix, starting with 1 element (0 0) ending with n elements.

memberdef.argsstring: (long int s_x, long int s_y, long int s_xx, long int s_yy, long int s_xy, long int n)
memberdef.name: Length

briefdescription.para: Calculates the length based on the given inertia tensor.
Calculates the major and minor axes based on the given inertia tensor.
Increments the cell's actual area by 1 unit.
Decrements the cell's actual area by 1 unit.
Sets the adhesive area of the cell.
Increments the cell's actual perimeter by 1 unit.
Decrements the cell's actual perimeter by 1 unit.
Sets target area to actual area, to remove "pressure".

detaileddescription.para: This is useful when reading an initial condition from an image.

briefdescription.para: Called whenever a cell is constructed, from constructor.
